description: Demolition of existing building and erection of a two-storey building to provide a school with associated multi use games area (MUGA), landscaping and parking.
decision_conditions: <p>No lighting should be affixed to the exterior of the building unless an exterior lighting strategy has been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, in writing. The strategy should include product, type and location of any lighting.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the the interests of protecting amenity, enhancing the character of the area, safeguarding public safety and highway safety, and in the interests of the prevention of crime and anti-social behaviour.</p>

<p>No ventilation, drainage, boxed services, antennas, satellite dishes, soil stacks, soil vent pipes, flues, ductwork or any other pipework shall be fixed to or affect the appearance of the external facade of the building other than as shown on the drawings hereby approved.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area.</p>

<p>&nbsp;ny additional, or unforeseen contamination encountered during the course of development shall be immediately notified to the Planning Authority and Contaminated Land Officer. All development shall cease in the affected area. Any additional or unforeseen contamination shall be dealt with as agreed with the Contaminated Land Officer. Where development has ceased in the affected area, it shall recommence upon written notification of the Planning Authority or Contaminated Land Officer.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To protect human health, water resources, property and the wider environment from harm and pollution resulting from land contamination.</p>

<div>The development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.</div><div><br></div><div>REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.</div>

<div>The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than three years after the date of this permission.</div><div><br></div><div>REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91(1) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 as amended.</div>

<div>Prior to the relevant part of the development, full details of materials for external surfaces, including glazing, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of the relevant parts of the development. Samples shall be provided on site for approval and shall include brick and mortar, cladding panel sample including any visible fixing and window frames.&nbsp;</div><div><br></div><div>The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved and retained in perpetuity.</div><div><br></div><div>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area.</div>

<p>Prior to the occupation of the development a final Delivery and Servicing Plan shall be submitted to and approved, in writing, by the Local Planning Authority, in consultation with Transport for London, setting out:</p><p><br></p><p>a. Frequency of deliveries per day/week </p><p>b. Size of vehicles</p><p>c.How vehicles would be accommodated on the public highway</p><p><br></p><p>Thereafter deliveries and servicing shall be carried out in accordance with the approved plan.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the proposed development does not prejudice the free flow of traffic or public safety along the neighbouring highway(s).</p>

<p>Prior to the undertaking of any works within the root protection areas of trees to be retained, as specified in the Arboricultural Impact Assessment prepared by Middlemarch Environment Ltd, an Arboricultural Method Statement should be submitted to and approved, in writing, by the Local Planning Authority. Thereafter works within the root protection areas shall be carried out in accordance with the approved Arboricultural Method Statement.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To protect the health of existing trees.</p>

<p>Prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved, a revised Energy Statement shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, providing full details to demonstrate at least the following standards and key metrics have been achieved or improved upon as set out in the hereby approved Energy Statement (Revision P03 by CPWP dated 19/07/24):</p><p><br></p><p>a. Minimum carbon savings of 1 % / 0.1 tonnes CO2e against Part L 2021 through fabric efficiency (Be Lean)</p><p>b. Minimum overall carbon savings of 75 % / 6.4 tonnes CO2e area against Part L 2021</p><p>c. Maximum G-values for windows and door: 0.35</p><p>d. Maximum Air permeability (m3/h/m2@50pa): 3</p><p>e. Maximum Energy Use Intensity of 67 kWh/sqm/yr using a predictive modelling calculation methodology CIBSE TM54 or equivalent - the applicant will be expected to demonstrate and quantify how further design works have been carried out to seek to achieve the aspirational target of 55 kWh/sqm/yr</p><p><br></p><p>The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thereby approved.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of addressing climate change and securing sustainable and net zero development and construction, in accordance with LP54, LP55 and LP56 of the Hackney Local Plan, SI2, SI3, SI4 and SI7 of the London Plan, and Section 14 of the National Planning Policy Framework.</p>

<p>Prior to the occupation of the development, full details including as built ventilation system (or any other related fixed plant adopted) specification and supporting drawings and installation certificates by an MSC registered installer must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority confirming the ventilation system has achieved or improved upon the pre-commencement figures,</p><p><br></p><p>The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thereby approved.</p><p><br></p><p>Where compliance is not met, a remedial plan and associated cost plan must be prepared and submitted to the Local Authority for approval detailing the necessary measures to meet the required level of performance.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of addressing climate change and securing sustainable and net zero development and construction, in accordance with LP54 and LP55 of the Hackney Local Plan, SI2 and SI4 of the London Plan, and Section 14 of the National Planning Policy Framework</p><div><br></div>

<p>Prior to the occupation of the development, a final “as-built” overheating risk assessment shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, assessing all units and following the CIBSE TM52 (non residential) methodology, confirming % pass rates for each TM49 weather file achieved or improved upon as set out in the hereby approved Energy Statement (Revision P03 by CPWP dated 19/07/24)</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of addressing climate change and securing sustainable and net zero development and construction, in accordance with LP54 and LP55 of the Hackney Local Plan, SI2, and SI4 of the London Plan, and Section 14 of the National Planning Policy Framework.</p>

<p>Prior to the first occupation of each building or part of a building or use, a 'Secured by Design' accreditation shall be obtained for such building or part of such building or use and thereafter all features are to be permanently retained.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of creating safer, sustainable communities.</p>

<p>Within 12 weeks of occupation of the development, the BREEAM Final Design Certificate shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, providing full details confirming the final rating and credits have been achieved or improved upon the pre-commencement figures - achieved credits must be presented in a tracker comparing credits achieved at BREEAM Interim Certification stage.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of addressing climate change and securing sustainable and net zero development and construction, in accordance with LP55 of the Hackney Local Plan, SI2 of the London Plan, and Section 14 of the National Planning Policy Framework.</p>

<p>Prior to the occupation of the development hereby approved, details of bird/bat box provision, including swift bricks, at or close to eaves level shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The bricks/boxes shall be retained thereafter in perpetuity.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To provide potential habitat for local wildlife.&nbsp;</p>

<p>All Non-Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) of net power of 37 kW and up to and including 560 kW used during the course of site preparation, demolition and construction phases shall comply with the emissions standards of the Mayor of London's NRMM Low Emission Zone for the Central Activities Zone and Opportunity Areas. Unless in compliance with these standards, no NRMM shall be on-site, at any time, whether in use or not, without the prior written consent of the local planning authority. The applicant shall keep an up-to-date register of all NRMM used during site preparation, demolition and construction phases on the online register at https://www.london.gov.uk/programmes-and-strategies/environment-and-climate-change/pollution-and-air-quality/nrmm</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To comply with London Plan Policy SI 1 and to ensure emissions from the site during the construction phase are acceptable with regard to public health and amenity.</p>

<p>Prior to the occupation of the development hereby approved, details of the positions of air intakes, vents and exhausts associated with any mechanical ventilation, air conditioning or any other ventilation system, supplying air to and extracting air from habitable rooms, shall be submitted for approval by the local planning authority. The development shall thereafter be implemented in accordance with the approved details.</p><p><br></p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To mitigate potential exposure of future occupiers to air pollution and to ensure the development complies with Hackney Local Plan 2033 Policy LP58 and London Plan Policy SI 1.</p>

<p>Prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved, the BREEAM Interim Design Certificate shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, providing full details to demonstrate at least the following standards have been met, as set out in the hereby approved BREEAM Pre Assessment (Revision 02 by Stroma dated 06/10/2023)- all the targeted credits must be presented in a tracker comparing credits targeted at BREEAM Pre Assessment stage:</p><p><br></p><p>a. Minimum BREEAM Rating of 72.8%&nbsp;</p><p>b. Life Cycle Assessment as required by Mat 6 Credit</p><p><br></p><p>The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thereby approved.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of addressing climate change and securing sustainable and net zero development and construction, in accordance with LP54 and LP55 of the Hackney Local Plan, SI2 and SI4 of the London Plan, and Section 14 of the National Planning Policy Framework.</p>

<p>Prior to occupation of the development hereby approved, a Biodiversity Net Gain Assessment and Plan, including proof of purchase of statutory credits, must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, demonstrating a minimum BNG score of 10% has been achieved</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To protect and enhance biodiversity in accordance with LP47 of the Hackney Local Plan as well as Section 15 of the National Planning Policy Framework.</p>

<p>Prior to the occupation of the development, full details including as built heating system (or any other related fixed plant adopted) specification and supporting drawings and installation certificates by an MSC registered installer must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority confirming the system performance has been achieved or improved upon the pre-commencement figures,</p><p><br></p><p>The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thereby approved.</p><p><br></p><p>Where compliance is not met, a remedial plan and associated cost plan must be prepared and submitted to the Local Authority for approval detailing the necessary measures to meet the required level of performance.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of addressing climate change and securing sustainable and net zero development and construction, in accordance with LP55 and LP56 of the Hackney Local Plan, SI2 and SI3 of the London Plan, and Section 14 of the National Planning Policy Framework.</p>

<p>Any plant shall be installed, together with any associated ancillary equipment, so as to prevent the transmission of noise and vibration into neighbouring premises. The rated noise level from all plant and ancillary equipment shall be 10dB(A) below the measured background noise level when measured at the nearest noise sensitive premises.</p><p><br></p><p>An assessment of the expected noise levels shall be carried out in accordance with BS4142:2014+A1:2019 ‘Methods for rating and assessing industrial and commercial sound’ and any mitigation measures necessary to achieve the above required noise levels shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority in writing for approval. The plant shall thereafter be installed and maintained in accordance with the approved details.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of protecting the amenity values of neighbouring occupiers.&nbsp;</p>

<p>Prior to the commencement of above ground construction, a policy compliant cycle parking plan for the provision of a minimum of 17 cycle parking spaces (1 of which should be short stay cycle parking spaces) shall be submitted and approved, in writing, by the Local Planning Authority and shall include:</p><p><br></p><p>a. Details of layout, foundation, stand type and spacing.</p><p>b. A minimum of 5% of long stay spaces should be for adapted/larger bikes.</p><p><br></p><p>If two tier racks are proposed they must have a mechanical or pneumatically assisted system for accessing the upper level. The storage spaces and stands must be kept in good working condition, in accordance with the thereby approved details, in perpetuity.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that adequate provision for the safe and secure storage of bicycles is made for future occupiers and in the interest of improving highway conditions in general.</p>

<p>Prior to occupation of the development, details of a Parking Design and Management Plan (PDMP) shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority. The PDMP shall include the following details:&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>(i) Safe design of the agreed number of off street car parking spaces and access for pedestrians and cyclists and minimisation of conflict between user groups; and&nbsp;</p><p>(ii) Details of provision of blue badge parking (minimum of 3 car parking spaces) and electric vehicle charging points; and</p><p>(iii) Details of how blue badge car parking spaces will be restricted to the intended purpose for the lifetime of the development; and</p><p>(iv) Permanent mechanisms for prevention of non-car parking areas to be used for that purpose; and&nbsp;</p><p>(v) Set out the measures proposed to enforce the car parking arrangements.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>The approved PDMP shall be implemented in full prior to occupation of the phase of development, fully implemented for the life of the development.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interests of highway safety, reducing reliance on private motor vehicles, and the amenity of neighbouring occupiers.</p>

<p>Prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved, a revised set of information demonstrating the ability for future connection to Decentralised Energy Network (DEN) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The submitted details shall include drawings drafted at the appropriate scale and full detailed specification of the following, but not be limited to:</p><p><br></p><p>a. Updated evidence of 2 ways correspondence between the applicant, the relevant local authority and network provider confirming the identified DHN has the capacity to serve the development, as well as supporting estimates of the CO2 emission factor to meet the limit set out in Part L 2021, installation cost and timescales for connection</p><p>b. Layout of energy centre/plant room showing space for future heat exchanger</p><p>c. Layout of obstacle free safeguarded route between heat exchanger and incoming DEN entry point</p><p>d. Details of on-site connection with pre-installed and capped with flange</p><p>e. Details of pre-installed pipework connecting identified plant room/ heat exchanger to proposed heating system(s)</p><p><br></p><p>Where it has been robustly demonstrated that a refrigerant based heating system (VRF) is the only viable option, a retrofit plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The retrofit plan should:</p><p><br></p><p>a. Detail how such system will be upgraded to a wet system compatible with a local DHN when there is a viable connection opportunity or when the system reaches its end of useful life whichever comes first and&nbsp;</p><p>b. Identify who will be responsible to implement the upgrade&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thereby approved.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of addressing climate change and securing sustainable and net zero development and construction, in accordance with LP55 and LP56 of the Hackney Local Plan, SI2, and SI3 of the London Plan, and Section 14 of the National Planning Policy Framework.</p>

<p>Prior to the installation of the heating and hot water system, full details including heating system (or any other related fixed plant adopted) specification and supporting drawings must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Authority to demonstrate at least the following standards been achieved or improved upon as set out in the hereby approved Energy Statement (Revision P03 by CPWP dated 19/07/24):</p><p><br></p><p>a. Heat pump Seasonal Coefficient of Performance of 3.66</p><p>b. Details of location of the condenser units from the heat pump systems and noise solutions to mitigate impact for nearby sensitive receptors;</p><p>c. Details of refrigerants that are required confirming a Low or Zero Global Warming Potential (GWP) and Zero Ozone Depleting Potential (ODP)</p><p><br></p><p>The heat pump thereby approved shall be installed prior to occupation of the development</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of addressing climate change and securing sustainable and net zero development and construction, in accordance with LP55 and LP56 of the Hackney Local Plan, SI2 and SI3 of the London Plan, and Section 14 of the National Planning Policy Framework.</p>

<p>Prior to the relevant part of the development, detailed drawings/full particulars of the proposed development showing the matters set out below must be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, in writing. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved which shall be implemented in full prior to the first use/occupation of the development.</p><p><br></p><p>a) 1:20 drawings of windows and doors including product descriptions&nbsp;</p><p>b) A plan showing the location of expansion joints and 1:5 detailed drawings of the expansion joints.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is of a high quality appearance and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area</p>

<p>Prior to the occupation of the development,&nbsp; a Final “as-built” Energy Statement shall be submitted and approved, in writing, by the Local Planning Authority confirming the following key metrics have been achieved or improved upon the pre-commencement figures:</p><p><br></p><p>a. As-built G-values for windows and doors using relevant datasheets</p><p>b. As-built Energy Use Intensity in kWh/sqm/yr using as-built modelling calculations&nbsp;</p><p>c. Full air permeability test report confirming all units have achieved the as design air permeability figures</p><p><br></p><p>Where compliance is not met, a remedial plan and associated cost plan must be prepared and submitted to the Local Authority for approval detailing the necessary measures to meet or improve upon the ‘as designed’ performance.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of addressing climate change and securing sustainable and net zero development and construction, in accordance with LP54, LP55 and LP56 of the Hackney Local Plan, SI2, SI3, SI4 and SI7 of the London Plan, and Section 14 of the National Planning Policy Framework.</p>

<p>Prior to the occupation of the development hereby approved, full details including installation certificates by MSC registered installer must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Authority providing full details to demonstrate at least the following standards have been met, as set out in the hereby approved Energy Statement (Revision P03 by CPWP dated 19/07/24)</p><p><br></p><p>a. Solar PV panels annual electricity peak generation of 58.22 kWp</p><p>b. Solar PV panels array of 270 sqm</p><p>c. Battery storage capacity of 48,103 kWh</p><p><br></p><p>The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thereby approved.</p><p><br></p><p>Where compliance is not met, a remedial plan and associated cost plan must be prepared and submitted to the Local Authority for approval detailing the necessary measures to meet or improve upon the ‘as designed’ performance.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of addressing climate change and securing sustainable and net zero development and construction, in accordance with LP55 of the Hackney Local Plan, SI2 of the London Plan, and Section 14 of the National Planning Policy Framework.</p>

<div>Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved, a Demolition and Construction Management Plan shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the local planning authority. The Plan shall be in accordance with Hackney Council’s Code of Construction Practice and the Mayor of London's Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition SPG, and other relevant guidance relating to dust and air quality. The development shall be implemented in accordance with details and measures approved in the Plan, covering the matters set out below, and shall be maintained throughout the entire construction period:&nbsp;</div><div><br></div><div>a. Demolition and construction method statement, covering all phases of the development. The results of the construction dust risk assessment carried out in the submitted Air Quality Assessment should be included. </div><div>b. Construction waste management plan setting out how resources will be managed and waste controlled at all stages of the project, including, details of dust mitigation measures to deal with construction waste during site clearance, demolition and construction works (including any breaking or crushing of concrete), and details of measures to be employed to mitigate noise and vibration demonstrating best practical means&nbsp;</div><div>c. An air quality and dust management plan, to include details of measures to control and mitigate emissions of dust from site clearance, demolition and construction activity, following best practice guidance. This should outline a scheme of monitoring of particulate matter (PM10) at the application site boundary, in line with the Mayor of London's SPG and other relevant guidance.&nbsp;</div><div>d. Details of locations where deliveries will be undertaken, the size and number of vehicles expected to access the site per day, access arrangement (including turning arrangements if necessary), details of parking suspensions (if required) and the duration of works.</div><div>e. The operation of site equipment generating noise and other nuisance causing activities, audible beyond the site boundary, shall only be carried out between the hours of 08:00-18:00 Mondays to Fridays, 08:00-13:00 Saturdays, and at no time on Sundays or bank holidays unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority. The best practical means available, in accordance with British Standard Code of Practice BS5228-1:2009 shall be employed at all times to minimise emission of noise and vibration.</div><div>f. A barrier shall be constructed around the site, to be erected prior to demolition.&nbsp;</div><div><br></div><div><br></div><div>REASON: To protect air quality and human health by minimising emissions during construction, to minimise nuisance caused by dust, noise and vibration, to avoid hazard and obstruction being caused to users of the public highway and in the interest of public safety and amenity.</div>

<p>No development shall commence, other than works of demolition until full detailed specification of the sustainable drainage system supported by appropriate calculations, construction details, drainage layout, and a site-specific management and maintenance plan have been submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing. Details shall include but not limited to the proposed blue/green roofs (with a substrate depth of at least 80mm not including vegetative mats), permeable paving, underground attenuation system, rain gardens, and the flow control system, which shall be submitted and approved by the LPA in consultation with the LLFA. Surface water from the site shall be managed according to the proposal referred to in the Boxing Academy Drainage Assessment (Ref: FS04658-HDE-ZZ-00-T-C-0003, Revision P02 by McLaren Construction) and the overall site peak discharge rate is restricted to 2 l/s.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of sustainable drainage.&nbsp;</p>

<p>Prior to the installation of the ventilation system, full details including ventilation system (or any other related fixed plant adopted) specification and supporting drawings must be submitted to and approved, in writing, by the Local Authority to demonstrate at least the following standards been achieved or improved upon as set out in the hereby approved Energy Statement (Revision P03 by CPWP dated 19/07/24):</p><p><br></p><p>a. Minimum MVRH efficiency of 85%&nbsp;</p><p>b. Details of summer by pass where applicable including provision and location across the development</p><p><br></p><p>The MVHR thereby approved shall be installed prior to occupation of the development</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of addressing climate change and securing sustainable and net zero development and construction, in accordance with LP54 and LP55 of the Hackney Local Plan, SI2 and SI4 of the London Plan, and Section 14 of the National Planning Policy Framework</p><div><br></div>
